column2: (semicolon) Command separator/terminator - note that semicolon is the only valid line feed.
column3: there will be a semicolon at the end of report
returns IDQ followed by model, software version, region, software build date e.g. "IDQMRX 710 US 1.1.9, Apr 16 2014"
returns IDM followed by model e.g. "IDMMRX 710"
returns IDS followed by software version e.g. "IDS1.1.9"
returns IDR followed by region e.g. "IDRUS"
returns IDB followed by software build date e.g. "IDBApr16 2013"
returns IDH followed by hardware version e.g. "IDH1"
returns IDN followed by the unit's unique address e.g. "IDN7CB77B000000"

column2: Upper case letters represent command, lower case represent variables which must be entered.
Tx status set. x=0 off, x=1 on (report running changes to any settings marked as Report)
Front panel brightness: 0=off, 1=low, 2=medium, 3=high, n=cycle to next

Set the video output configuration parameters. w = HDMI 1 Color Depth (0=Auto, 1=8bit). x = HDMI 2 Color Depth (0=Auto, 1=8bit). y = Video Output (0=Auto, 1=HDMI1, 2=HDMI2). z = Video Scaling (0=Processed, 1=Passthrough)
Set Dolby Volume off (y=0) or on (y=1) for the Input # xx (xx=00-ZZ where ZZ is the number of active input configurations, 00=the current input).
Set Dolby Volume Leveler to y (0=off, 1-9) for the Input # xx (xx=00-ZZ where ZZ is the number of active input configurations, 00=the current input).
Set Lip Sync to yyy (0-150) ms for the Input # xx (xx=00-ZZ where ZZ is the number of active input configurations, 00=the current input).  Step must be in increments of 5ms or error will result.

Set Standby IP Control to Disabled (x=0) or Enabled (x=1). This must be enabled for the power-on command to operate via IP. With serial control, the power-on command need not be sent twice (once for wake-up) when this setting is enabled. Note that sending SIP1 disables ECO mode.

Power. x=zone: 0 (all), 1 (main), 2 (where applicable), 3 (where applicable).  y: 0=off, 1=on.  When unit is in ECO standby mode (see product manual), it may be necessary to send the power-on command twice. Ex:"Z0POW1;Z0POW1;". The first instance is the wake-up from low-power state. Note that Zx=Z0 applies only to power command.
From this point "Zx" at the beginning of a command represents zone selection as above.
Query number of active input configurations that the system supports
column3: returns ICNyy e.g. "ICN9" for a system with 9 active inputs

column2: Query the short input name of the input yy=01-ZZ.
column3: returns 'ISNyyzzzz' where 'zzzz'= Input name as set in the setup menu. Maximum length of the short input name is 8 ASCII characters.

column2: Query the long input name of the input yy=01-ZZ.
column3: returns 'ILNyyzzzz' where 'zzzz'= Input name as set in the setup menu. Maximum length of the long input name is 16 ASCII characters (not applicable to MRX x10).

column2: Input Select: yy=01-ZZ. Where ZZ is the number of active input configurations for the specified zone. Eg: 'Z1INP9' would select the 9th input in the main zone. When selecting an input that has no input connector assigned to Z2 the MRX x10 will silently ignore the input select command.
Volume up: y=dB step: 0 to 10, m=minimum according to model. Entry is rounded to nearest valid value
Volume down: y=dB step: 0 to 10, m=minimum according to model. Entry is rounded to nearest valid value.
Volume setting: s=sign: +/-, yy=value.  Example: Z1VOL-35 represents main zone volume set to -35 dB.  Entry is rounded to nearest valid value.
Turn ARC (Anthem Room Correction) off (y=0) or on (y=1) for the specified zone (currently ARC is only available on the Main zone, x=1)

Balance, level, and tone commands below do not pertain to system setup, they are on-the-fly adjustments meant to compensate for source material anomalies.  For system setup, use the setup menu in the preamp/receiver, and Anthem Room Correction.
Balance all channels to left: y= %: 0 to 100, m=minimum according to model. Entry is rounded to nearest valid value.
Balance all channels to right: y= %: 0 to 100, m=minimum according to model. Entry is rounded to nearest valid value.

Balance setting: yyy=% 0 to 100. Example: Z1BAL100 represents balance completely to the right. Z1BAL0 represents balance completely to the left. Z1BAL50 is balance in the middle. Entry is rounded to nearest valid value.
Level up: y=channels: 0=subs, 1=fronts, 2=center, 3=surrounds, 4=backs, 5=LFE. y=dB step: 0 to 10, m=minimum according to model
Level down: y=channels: 0=subs, 1=fronts, 2=center, 3=surrounds, 4=backs, 5=LFE. y=dB step: 0 to 10, m=minimum according to model

Level setting: y=Channels: 0=subs, 1=fronts, 2=center, 3=surrounds, 4=backs, 5=LFE. s=sign: +/-, zz=value.  Example: Z1LEV1+01 represents fronts boosted by 1 dB.  Entry is rounded to nearest valid value. Subs, fronts, center, surrounds, backs have range -10 dB to +10 dB. LFE has range -10 dB to 0 dB.
Tone up: y=0 bass, 1 treble, zz=dB step: 0 to 10, m=minimum according to model. Step must be in increments of 2 or error will result.
Tone down: y=0 bass, 1 treble, zz=dB step: 0 to 10, m=minimum according to model. Step must be in increments of 2 or error will result.
Tone setting: y=0 bass, 1 treble.  s=sign: +/-, zz=value.  Example: Z1TON0-02 represents a bass cut by 2 dB.  Step must be in increments of 2 or error will result.
band select x=1 AM, x=2 FM
Tuner AM setting: 531-1710 kHz (9 kHz setting in menu, 240V default) or 530-1710 kHz (10 kHz setting in menu, 120V default)
Tuner FM setting: 87.50-108.00. Picks nearest valid frequency.

column3:
returns ZxTBSy where
x=1 Main Zone
x=2 Zone2
y=0 Not on Tuner
y=1 Tuner on AM
y=2 Tuner on FM

column2: Assign the current station to preset xx (01-30)
column3: T1PSA? returns T1PSAyy (yy=00-30). 00=current station not assigned to a preset

column2: Remove the preset xx. xx=00-30. 00=current station is removed from all presets
Simulate IR command. yyyy=IR command as listed at the bottom of this document.
Display custom on-screen status message for duration of display timeout: x=row 0-1, yyyy=message (number of characters and rows available depends on model)
Query active horizontal video resolution (in pixels)
Query active vertical video resolution (in pixels/lines)
Query audio input channels: 0=no input, 1=other, 2=mono (center channel only), 3=2-channel, 4=5.1-channel, 5=6.1-channel, 6=7.1-channel
Query audio input format: 0=no input, 1=Analog, 2=PCM, 3=Dolby, 4= DSD, 5=DTS. Not all models support all formats (ex: DSD).
Query audio input bit rate (kbps). For Analog/PCM inputs this is equal to the sample rate multiplied by the bit depth and the number of channels
Query the current audio input name (maximum of 16 characters returned)
column3: Returns Z1AINx. Ex: Current audio input format is DTS Master Audio. 'Z1AIN?' Returns 'Z1AINDTS Master Audio'

column2: Query the current audio input rate name (maximum of 16 characters returned).
column3: Returns Z1AIRx. For lossy input formats, returns the bit rate (ex 'Z1AIR384 kbps'). For lossless audio, analog audio, or PCM audio inputs it returns the sample rate (ex: Z1AIR48 kHz).

column2: Audio Listening Mode: 00=None, 01=AnthemLogic-Movie, 02=AnthemLogic-Music, 03=PLIIx Movie, 04=PLIIx Music, 05=Neo:6 Cinema, 06=Neo:6 Music, 07=All Channel Stereo*, 08=All-Channel Mono*, 09=Mono*, 10=Mono-Academy*, 11=Mono(L)*, 12=Mono(R)*, 13=High Blend*, na=cycle to next applicable, pa=cycle to previous applicable.  *Applicable to 2-channel source only. Some options are not available in all models or under all circumstances.
Dolby PLIIx Music center width up.  Applicable only when PLIIx Music is selected for 2-channel source.
Dolby PLIIx Music center width down.  Applicable only when PLIIx Music is selected for 2-channel source.
Dolby PLIIx Music center width setting: y=0-7.  Applicable only when PLIIx Music is selected for 2-channel source.
Dolby PLIIx Music Dimension up.  Applicable only when PLIIx Music is selected for 2-channel source.
Dolby PLIIx Music Dimension down.  Applicable only when PLIIx Music is selected for 2-channel source.
Dolby PLIIx Music Dimension setting: y=0-6.  Applicable only when PLIIx Music is selected for 2-channel source.
Dolby PLIIx Music Panorama. y=0 off, y=1 on.  Applicable only when PLIIx Music is selected for 2-channel source.
Dolby Digital Dynamic Range (Dolby Digital 5.1 source): 0=Normal, 1=Reduced, 2=Late Night, n=cycle to next

column3: returns DIAx where x is dB of normalization, n=not applicable

column2: Trigger control. x=trigger # 0=trigger 1, 1=trigger 2, y=0 menu control, y=1 RS-232/IP
Trigger set: x: 0=trigger 1, 1=trigger 2.  y: 0=off, 1=on. Only available if trigger control has been set to RS-232/IP for the specified trigger

column1: To send a power-on command, send "Z1POW1;" using the semi-colon ";" command separator/terminator.
1. Successful serial commands return ';' after the action is completed.

2. When a recognized command cannot be executed "!E<OriginalCommand>" is returned. Ex: trigger control is set to Menu, and "R1SET1;" is sent on the serial port, then the system would return "!ER1SET1<LF>". Ex2: no tuner preset assigned for preset #03 and "T1PSL03<LF>" is sent then the system would return "!ET1PSL03<LF>"
3. Out-of-range parameters return the message "!R<OriginalCommand>". Ex: 'Z1VOL+50;' would result in a response: '!RZ1VOL+50;'
4. Invalid commands return the message "!I<OriginalCommand>". Ex 'HELLO;' would result in a response '!IHELLO;'
5. Receiving a command for a zone when the zone is off (but the system is not in standby), returns the message "!Z<OriginalMessage>".
6. Ony a few commands are valid when the system is in standby 'IDM?', 'ZxPOWy', 'ZxPOW?'. All other commands are considered 'Invalid'.
7. Maximum command length is 256 bytes including the terminator. Maximum response length is 258 bytes.
8. Average command processing latency must be less than 30 ms.
9. Individual commands have a maximum processing latency of 100 ms.
10. Systems that communicate over RS232 should wait for at least 1 s for a response before retransmision

11. When Standby IP Control is disabled in setup menu (this saves energy), the unit can still be powered on serially but power-on command must be sent twice - wait for semicolon response before sending power-on command the second time (around 1s). To avoid having to send power-on command twice, enable Standby IP Control via SIPx command.

12. MRX x10 software v1.1.9 and later forces Z2 tuner input selection to use the same band as Main in the event that one zone is trying to use AM and the other zone is trying to use FM. The forced change is not reported therefore the following queries must be used to keep status up to date:

a) When main input changes, query tuner status (Z1TBS?).

b) When Z2 input changes, query tuner status (Z2TBS?).

c) When both zones are on and Main input changes, query Z2 input to see whether it also changed (Z2INP?).
Straight-wired DB9 is used for PC connection.
Simulated IR Command values for ZxSIMyyyy (use 0 to fill in blanks Ex: Key 1 = 0001)
